00016 static void AILCALLBACK timer_func( UINT32 user )
00017 {
00018       AudioGapList      *pGapList;
00019 
00020       pGapList = (AudioGapList*)user;
00021 
00022   pGapList->gap_monitor_timer += GAP_TIMER_INTERVAL;
00023 
00024   if ( pGapList->audio_gap_active )
00025   {
00026    if ( (pGapList->gap_monitor_timer / 1000) > pGapList->end[ pGapList->gap_monitor_current] )
00027     {
00028       pGapList->audio_gap_active = 0;
00029       pGapList->gap_monitor_current++;
00030     }
00031   }
00032   else
00033       {
00034     if ( pGapList->gap_monitor_current < pGapList->count )
00035             {
00036       if ( ( pGapList->gap_monitor_timer / 1000) >= pGapList->start[ pGapList->gap_monitor_current ])
00037       {
00038                         pGapList->audio_gap_active = 1;
00039       }
00040             }
00041       }
00042 }

00046 void AudioGapListInit( CHAR8 *zSoundFile, AudioGapList      *pGapList )
00047 {
00048       // This procedure will load in the appropriate .gap file, corresponding
00049       // to the .wav file in szSoundEffects indexed by uiSampleNum
00050       // The procedure will then allocate and load in the AUDIO_GAP information,
00051       // while counting the number of elements loaded 
00052 
00053 //    FILE *pFile;
00054       HWFILE pFile;
00055       STR pSourceFileName;
00056       STR pDestFileName;
00057       char sFileName[256];
00058       UINT8 counter=0;
00059       AUDIO_GAP *pCurrentGap, *pPreviousGap;
00060       UINT32 Start;
00061       UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
00062 
00063       UINT32 End;
00064 
00065 
00066       pSourceFileName= zSoundFile;
00067       pDestFileName=sFileName;
00068       //Initialize GapList
00069       pGapList->size=0;
00070       pGapList->current_time=0;
00071       pGapList->pHead=0;
00072       pGapList->pCurrent=0;
00073       pGapList->audio_gap_active=FALSE;
00074       pPreviousGap=pCurrentGap=0;
00075       //DebugMsg(TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3,String("File is %s", szSoundEffects[uiSampleNum]));
00076       // Get filename
00077       strcpy(pDestFileName, pSourceFileName);
00078       // strip .wav and change to .gap
00079 
00080       while(pDestFileName[counter] !='.')
00081       {
00082             counter++;
00083       }
00084 
00085       pDestFileName[counter+1]='g';
00086       pDestFileName[counter+2]='a';
00087       pDestFileName[counter+3]='p';
00088       pDestFileName[counter+4]='\0';
00089 
00090       pFile = FileOpen(pDestFileName, FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE );
00091       if( pFile )
00092       {
00093                   counter=0;
00094              // gap file exists
00095              // now read in the AUDIO_GAPs
00096                   
00097              //fread(&Start,sizeof(UINT32), 1, pFile);
00098              FileRead( pFile, &Start,sizeof(UINT32), &uiNumBytesRead );
00099             
00100 
00101             //    while ( !feof(pFile) )
00102                   while ( !FileCheckEndOfFile( pFile ) )
00103                   {
00104                          // can read the first element, there exists a second
00105                               //fread(&End, sizeof(UINT32),1,pFile);
00106                          FileRead( pFile, &End, sizeof(UINT32), &uiNumBytesRead );
00107                          
00108                          // allocate space for AUDIO_GAP
00109                          pCurrentGap = (AUDIO_GAP *)MemAlloc( sizeof(AUDIO_GAP) );
00110                          if (pPreviousGap !=0)
00111                                      pPreviousGap->pNext=pCurrentGap;
00112                          else
00113                                     {
00114                                      // Start of list
00115                                      pGapList->pCurrent=pCurrentGap;
00116                                      pGapList->pHead=pCurrentGap;
00117                                     }
00118 
00119                          pGapList->size++;
00120                          pCurrentGap->pNext=0;
00121                          pCurrentGap->uiStart=Start;
00122                          pCurrentGap->uiEnd=End;
00123                          DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Gap Start %d and Ends %d", Start, End) );
00124 
00125                          // Increment pointer
00126                          pPreviousGap=pCurrentGap;
00127        
00128                         //    fread(&Start,sizeof(UINT32), 1, pFile);
00129                          FileRead( pFile, &Start, sizeof(UINT32), &uiNumBytesRead );
00130                   }
00131                                     
00132                   pGapList->audio_gap_active=FALSE;
00133                   pGapList->current_time=0;
00134             
00135    
00136       //fclose(pFile);
00137                    FileClose( pFile );
00138              }
00139              DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Gap List Started From File %s and has %d gaps", pDestFileName,  pGapList->size) );
00140 
00141 }
00142 
00143 void AudioGapListDone( AudioGapList *pGapList )
00144 {
00145  // This procedure will go through the  AudioGapList and free space/nullify pointers 
00146  // for any allocated elements
00147 
00148       AUDIO_GAP *pCurrent, *pNext;
00149  if (pGapList->pHead !=0)     
00150             {
00151        
00152          pCurrent=pGapList->pHead;
00153      pNext=pCurrent->pNext;
00154          // There are elements in the list
00155           while(pNext !=0)
00156                                     {
00157              // kill pCurrent
00158                              MemFree(pCurrent);
00159                                      pCurrent=pNext;
00160                                      pNext=pNext->pNext;
00161                                     }
00162                   // now kill the last element
00163                   MemFree(pCurrent);
00164       pCurrent=0;  
00165             
00166             }
00167  pGapList->pHead=0;
00168  pGapList->pCurrent=0;
00169  pGapList->size = 0;
00170  DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Audio Gap List Deleted") );
00171 }

00175 void PollAudioGap( UINT32 uiSampleNum, AudioGapList *pGapList )
00176 {
00177  // This procedure will access the AudioGapList pertaining to the .wav about
00178  // to be played and sets the audio_gap_active flag. This is done by
00179  // going to the current AUDIO_GAP element in the AudioGapList, comparing to see if
00180  //   the current time is between the uiStart and uiEnd. If so, set flag..if not and
00181  // the uiStart of the next element is not greater than current time, set current to next and repeat
00182  // ...if next elements uiStart is larger than current_time, or no more elements..
00183  // set flag FALSE
00184  
00185       UINT32 time;
00186  AUDIO_GAP *pCurrent;
00187 
00188  if(!pGapList)
00189  {
00190        // no gap list, return
00191        return;
00192  }
00193 
00194  if (pGapList->size > 0)
00195  {
00196   time=SoundGetPosition(uiSampleNum);
00197 //  DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Sound Sample Time is %d", time) );
00198  }
00199  else
00200  {
00201     pGapList->audio_gap_active=(FALSE); 
00202             return;
00203  }
00204  
00205  // set current ot head of gap list for this sound
00206  pCurrent = pGapList -> pHead;
00207 
00208  // check to see if we have fallen behind
00209  if( ( time > pCurrent-> uiEnd ) )
00210  {
00211        // fallen behind
00212        // catchup
00213        while( time > pCurrent -> uiEnd )
00214        {
00215              pCurrent = pCurrent -> pNext;
00216              if( ! pCurrent )
00217              {           
00218        pGapList->audio_gap_active=(FALSE);
00219                    return;
00220              }
00221        }
00222  }
00223  
00224  
00225 
00226 
00227  // check to see if time is within the next AUDIO_GAPs start time
00228  if ( ( time > pCurrent ->uiStart ) && ( time < pCurrent->uiEnd ) )
00229                   {
00230            
00231            if ((time >pCurrent->uiStart)&&(time < pCurrent->uiEnd))
00232                    {
00233                          // we are within the time frame
00234                    DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Gap Started at %d", time) );
00235                          pGapList->audio_gap_active=(TRUE);
00236                                
00237                    }
00238        else if ( (time > pCurrent->uiEnd)&&(pGapList->audio_gap_active == TRUE) )
00239                    {
00240                          // reset if already set
00241                          pGapList->audio_gap_active=(FALSE);
00242                      DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Gap Ended at %d", time) );
00243                    }
00244                   }
00245   else
00246       {
00247     pGapList->audio_gap_active=(FALSE);
00248       }
00249 
00250 }

00253 UINT32 PlayJA2GapSample( CHAR8 *zSoundFile, UINT32 usRate, UINT32 ubVolume, UINT32 ubLoops, UINT32 uiPan, AudioGapList* pData )
00254 {
00255       SOUNDPARMS spParms;
00256 
00257       memset(&spParms, 0xff, sizeof(SOUNDPARMS));
00258 
00259       spParms.uiSpeed = usRate;
00260       spParms.uiVolume =  (UINT32) (  ( ubVolume / (FLOAT) HIGHVOLUME ) * GetSpeechVolume( ) );
00261       spParms.uiLoop = ubLoops;
00262       spParms.uiPan = uiPan;
00263       spParms.uiPriority=GROUP_PLAYER;
00264 
00265       // Setup Gap Detection, if it is not null
00266       if( pData != NULL )
00267             AudioGapListInit( zSoundFile, pData );
00268       
00269       return(SoundPlayStreamedFile( zSoundFile, &spParms));
00270 }
